title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Shadow Climate Change Minister Mark Butler says it's too early to decide on an emissions reduction target for the party to take to the next election. Divisions have emerged in Opposition ranks, after Joel Fitzgibbon called on Labor to adopt the government's 2030 goal of cutting carbon pollution by 28 per cent. Mr Butler rejected the suggestion, arguing the Coalition's policy was inconsistent with the Paris Agreement. Mr Butler told Sky News the party would take its time to land on a new position. Image: News Corp Australia
